Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Single-Dose vs. Divided-Dose rATG Induction in Renal Transplantation

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a single center, 180 adult renal transplant recipients

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either SD-rATG (6 mg/kg over 24 hours) or DD-rATG (four 1.5 mg/kg doses on alternate days)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was renal function, measured by the abbreviated modification of diet in renal disease formula, over a follow-up period averaging 51.8 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was not concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: 90 participants were randomised to each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: analysis conducted on an intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: SD-rATG was associated with improved renal function in deceased donor recipients (P <0.001)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were more frequent in the DD group, with higher infection rates
